Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 65th overall pick, by New Jersey in 1972...
Injured on 4/12/1972 with a Bruised Hand, out for 2 days...
Had first career hit on 6/16/1975, off Curtis French (SHP)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/24/1975, off James Boos (MAN)...
Had 5 hits with 5 RBI against Wisconsin on 6/27/1977...
Was selected to the 1977 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/28/1978, hitting .462 with 2 HR, 9 RBI...
Injured on 8/13/1978 with a Jammed Finger, out for one week...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Leftfield in 1981...
Was selected to the 1983 Allstar game...
Had 20-game hitting streak snapped on 5/18/1984...
Traded from New Jersey to Halifax on 7/17/1986 (Going to NJ: 1B D. Audet. Going to HAL: LF R. Arceniaga, P S. Olmos)...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Longport on 9/14/1986...
